definition: loincloth/(fig.) fig leaf/CL:塊|块[kuai4]
to cover up (a shortcoming)/to screen off/to hide/to conceal
shy/ashamed/shame/bashful/variant of 饈|馐[xiu1]/delicacies
cloth/to declare/to announce/to spread/to make known
variant of 布[bu4]/to announce/to spread

sentences.english: Sanctions were a mere fig-leaf for weak politicians.
sentences.chinese: 制裁只是无能政客的遮羞布。

sentences.english: But that fig leaf has since blown away.
sentences.chinese: 但是那片遮羞布被吹走了。

sentences.english: Can we say that Yao Ming is the fig leaf created by the Chinese Men's Basketball Team?
sentences.chinese: 难道我们可以说姚明是国家男篮创造出的遮羞布吗？

definition: to cover up one's embarrassment/to hush up a scandal
stepping stone/fig. person used to advance one's career
scar
bare/naked/(fig.) plain/undisguised/unadorned
to pretend that everything is going well
the Emperor's new clothes (i.e. naked)
shield/(fig.) excuse
stumbling block/obstacle/someone who gets in your way
sacrificial victim/sb who is expendable/item sold at a loss
don't pass judgment on a person's life until the lid is on the coffin (idiom)
lit. to cover one's ears whilst stealing a bell/to deceive oneself/to bury one's head in the sand (idiom)
that's all/nothing more
to sink down to/to be reduced to (sth inferior)
to paint/to whitewash/to decorate/plaster/fig. to gloss over/to cover up
high-sounding/dignified/pompous (idiom)
trying to hide it makes it more conspicuous (idiom); A cover up only makes matters worse.
